tags.name: OCPP 1.6 Firmware Management
tags.description: Support for firmware update management and diagnostic log file download.

tags.name: OCPP 1.6 Smart Charging
tags.description: Support for basic Smart Charging, for instance using control pilot.

tags.name: OCPP 2.0.1 Provisioning
tags.description:
All the functionalities that help a CSO provision their Charging Stations, allowing them on their
network and retrieving configuration information from these Charging Stations. Additionally, it consists of the ability to retrieve
information about the configuration of Charging Stations, make changes to the configuration etc. This chapter also covers resetting
a Charging Station and migrating to a new NetworkConnectionProfile.

tags.name: OCPP 1.6 Local Auth List Management
tags.description: Features to manage the local authorization list in Charge Points.

tags.name: OCPP 2.0.1 Remote Control
tags.description: Use cases for remote control management from the CSMS

tags.name: [OCPP 2.0.1] Reservation
tags.description:
The reservation functionality enables an EV Driver to make a
reservation of a Charging Station/EVSE, ensuring an available Connector at a Charging Station when he arrives.

tags.name: OCPP 1.6 Remote Trigger
tags.description: Support for remote triggering of Charging Station initiated messages

tags.name: [OCPP 2.0.1] Security
tags.description: The security requirements for the OCPP protocol.

get.summary: Get network logs for charging station based on criteria filters.
get.description:
Searches for network logs by identity key and the provided search criteria, paginated.
#### If a criteria filter is not provided, it will not be used in the search.
#### If multiple criteria filters are provided, the search will only return results that match all the provided criteria.
#### If applied criteria had no match, page is blank.

parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.description: Optional date filter for fetching logs after this timestamp.

parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.description: Optional date filter for fetching logs before this timestamp.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Optional filter specifying the WebSocket event type.

parameters.name: serviceInstance
parameters.description: Optional filter specifying the service instance of the log.

parameters.name: webSocketInteraction
parameters.description: Optional filter specifying the WebSocket interaction.

delete.description: Deletes a user account access request

isActive.description: Indicates if the user account is active

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user

displayName.description: The display name of the user

dateCreatedAt.description: The date and time when the user account was created in the system

isActive.description: Indicates if the user account is active

text.description: Text to be displayed to a end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

DisplayText.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

is_green_energy.description: True if 100% from regenerative sources. (CO2 and nuclear waste is zero)

energy_sources.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources of this location’s tariff.

environ_impact.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of nuclear waste and CO2 exhaust of this location’s tariff.

supplier_name.description: Name of the energy supplier, delivering the energy for this location or tariff.

energy_product_name.description: Name of the energy suppliers product/tariff plan used at this location.

EnergyMix.description: This type is used to specify the energy mix and environmental impact of the supplied energy at a location or in a tariff.

percentage.description: Percentage of this source (0-100) in the mix.

EnergySource.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources. All given values of all categories should add up to 100 percent.

amount.description: Amount of this portion in g/kWh.

EnvironmentalImpact.description: Amount of waste produced/emitted per kWh.

Price.description: When this field is set, a Charging Session with this tariff will NOT cost more than this amount.

price.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension.

vat.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here.

step_size.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. Amounts that are less then this step_size are rounded up to the given step_size. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed.

PriceComponent.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPO’s platform (and suboperator platforms).

currency.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

type.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

tariff_alt_text.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

tariff_alt_url.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

start_date_time.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active.

end_date_time.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Tariff was last updated (or created).

Tariff.description: A Tariff object consists of a list of one or more Tariff Elements, which can be used to create complex Tariff structures.

price_components.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

reservation.description: When this field is present, the TariffElement describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the driver starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation.

start_time.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros.Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]

end_time.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time. If end_time < start_time then the period wraps around to the next day. To stop at end of the day use: 00:00.

start_date.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day (inclusive).Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

end_date.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of theLocation, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive).Same syntax as start_date.

min_kwh.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy (inclusive) being used.

max_kwh.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy (exclusive) being used.

min_current.description: Sum of the minimum current (in Amperes) over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than, or equal to, the defined amount of current, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value.

max_current.description: Sum of the maximum current (in Amperes) over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value.

min_power.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than, or equal to, the defined amount of power, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value.

max_power.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value.

min_duration.description: Minimum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this TariffElement is not yet active.

max_duration.description: Maximum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is shorter than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. After that moment, this TariffElement is no longer active.

day_of_week.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

items.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

TariffRestrictions.description: These restrictions are not for the entire Charging Session. They only describe if and when a TariffElement becomes active or inactive during a Charging Session.

currency.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

type.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

tariff_alt_text.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

tariff_alt_url.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

start_date_time.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active.

end_date_time.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location canbe used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future.

clientId.description: The OpenID Connect client ID of the application

userName.description:
Login user of the SMTP server. Set the username for the account at the mail host, if any.
Note that smtpAuth is set to true, else the specified username will not be sent to the
mail server by the runtime.

password.description:
Login password of the SMTP server. Set the password for the account at the mail host, if any.
Note that smtpAuth is set to true, else the specified password will not be sent to the
mail server by the runtime.

smtpAuth.description: Indicates that SMTP AUTH is required

startTlsEnabled.description: Inform the email server that the email client wants to upgrade from an insecure connection to a secure one using TLS

startTlsRequired.description: Secure TLS email server connection is required

identityKey.description: The Identity Key of the Charging Station

chargingStationName.description: This contains the name of the Charging Station, if no name given: “<Model Name> + <Charger ID>

chargingStationModel.description: This contains a value that identifies the model of the Charging Station

dateCreated.description: This contains the creation date and time of the  of Charging Station

online.description: Indicates if the Charging Station is online.

csmsConnected.description: Indicates if the CSMS is connected.

csmsUuid.description: This contains the UUID of the CSMS.

latitude.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: '.', Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

longitude.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: '.' Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

GeoLocation.description: This class defines the geo location of the Charge Point. The geodetic system to be used is WGS 84.

uuid.description: Unique Id of the CSMS, used for external identifier.

isDefault.description: Identifies if the current CSMS is the default one or not

username.description: The user name of the CSMS credentials

password.description: The password of the CSMS credentials

ocppProtocol.description: Defines the OCPP protocol version which is supported by the CSMS in case only one version is supported. Will be used for protocol version translation

isCsmsCredentialsUsed.description: Identifies whether the CSMS credentials are going to be used or not.

isDefault.description: Identifies if the current CSMS is the default one or not

username.description: The user name of the CSMS credentials

password.description: The password of the CSMS credentials

confirmPassword.description: The confirmation password of the CSMS credentials

ocppProtocol.description: Defines the OCPP protocol version which is supported by the CSMS in case only one version is supported. Will be used for protocol version translation

isCsmsCredentialsUsed.description: Identifies whether the CSMS credentials are going to be used or not.

identityKey.description: The Identity Key of the Charging Station

chargingStationName.description: This contains the name of the Charging Station, if no name given: “<Model Name> + <Charger ID>

chargingStationModel.description: This contains a value that identifies the model of the Charging Station

dateCreated.description: This contains the creation date and time of the  of Charging Station

online.description: Indicates if the Charging Station is online.

csmsConnected.description: Indicates if the CSMS is connected.

csmsUuid.description: This contains the UUID of the CSMS.

tenantId.description: This contains the ID of the Tenant.

chargingStationModel.description: The model of the Charging Station

chargingStationName.description: The name of the Charging Station if no name given: “<Model Name> + <Charger ID>“

currency.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

type.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

tariff_alt_text.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

tariff_alt_url.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

start_date_time.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active.

end_date_time.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future.

reasonCode.description: Required. A predefined code for the reason why the status is returned in this response. The string is case-insensitive.

additionalInfo.description: Optional. Additional text to provide detailed information.

status.description: Required. This field indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

location.description: Required. URI defining the origin of the firmware.

retrieveDateTime.description: Required. Date and time at which the firmware shall be retrieved.

installDateTime.description: Optional. Date and time at which the firmware shall be installed.

signingCertificate.description: Optional. Certificate with which the firmware was signed. PEM encoded X.509 certificate.

OcppFirmwareType.description: Required. Specifies the firmware to be updated on the Charging Station.

retries.description: Optional. This specifies how many times Charging Station must try to download the firmware before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retryInterval.description: Optional. The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how long to wait between attempts.

requestId.description: Required. The Id of this request

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the Local Controller succeeded in unpublishing the firmware.

checksum.description: Required. The MD5 checksum over the entire firmware file as a hexadecimal string of length 32.

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station has unlocked the connector.

evseId.description: Required. This contains the identifier of the EVSE for which a connector needs to be unlocked.

connectorId.description: Required. This contains the identifier of the connector that needs to be unlocked.

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the Charging Station will send the requested notification or not.

id.description: Required. EVSE Identifier. This contains a number (> 0) designating an EVSE of the Charging Station.

connectorId.description: Optional. An id to designate a specific connector (on an EVSE) by connector index number.

OcppEVSEType.description: Specifies the EVSE when component is located at EVSE level, also specifies the connector when component is located at Connector level.

requestedMessage.description: Required. Type of message to be triggered.

name.description: Name of the component. Name should be taken from the list of standardized component names whenever possible. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

instance.description: Name of instance in case the component exists as multiple instances. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

OcppComponentType.description: Required. Component for which the Variable is requested.

attributeType.description: Type of attribute: Actual, Target, MinSet, MaxSet. Default is Actual when omitted.

attributeStatus.description: Result status of setting the variable.

OcppSetVariableResultType.description: List of result statuses per Component-Variable

name.description: Required. Name of the variable. Name should be taken from the list of standardized variable names whenever possible. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

instance.description: Optional. Name of instance in case the variable exists as multiple instances. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

OcppVariableType.description: Required. Variable for which status is returned.

setVariableResult.description: List of result statuses per Component-Variable

attributeType.description: Optional. Type of attribute: Actual, Target, MinSet, MaxSet. Default is Actual when omitted.

attributeValue.description: Required. Value to be assigned to attribute of variable. The value is allowed to be an empty string (""). The Configuration Variable ConfigurationValueSize can be used to limit SetVariableData.attributeValue and VariableCharacteristics.valueList. The max size of these values will always remain equal.

OcppSetVariableDataType.description: List of Component-Variable pairs and attribute values to set

setVariableData.description: List of Component-Variable pairs and attribute values to set

id.description: Optional. Id given to the VariableMonitor by the Charging Station. The Id is only returned when status is accepted. Installed VariableMonitors should have unique id’s but the id’s of removed Installed monitors should have unique id’s but the id’s of removed monitors MAY be reused.

status.description: Required. Status is OK if a value could be returned. Otherwise this will indicate the reason why a value could not be returned.

type.description: Required. The type of this monitor, e.g. a threshold, delta or periodic monitor.

severity.description:
Required. The severity that will be assigned to an event
     * that is triggered by this monitor. The severity range is 0-9,
     * with 0 as the highest and 9 as the lowest severity level.
     * The severity levels have the following meaning:
     * 0-Danger
     * Indicates lives are potentially in danger. Urgent attention
     * is needed and action should be taken immediately.
     * 1-Hardware Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to Hardware issues. Action is
     * required.
     * 2-System Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to software or minor hardware
     * issues. Action is required.
     * 3-Critical
     * Indicates a critical error. Action is required.
     * 4-Error
     * Indicates a non-urgent error. Action is required.
     * 5-Alert
     * Indicates an alert event. Default severity for any type of
     * monitoring event.
     * 6-Warning
     * Indicates a warning event. Action may be required.
     * 7-Notice
     * Indicates an unusual event. No immediate action is
     * required.
     * 8-Informational
     * Indicates a regular operational event. May be used for
     * reporting, measuring throughput, etc. No action is
     * required.
     * 9-Debug
     * Indicates information useful to developers for debugging,
     * not useful during operations.

OcppSetMonitoringResultType.description: Required. List of result statuses per monitor.

setMonitoringResult.description: Required. List of result statuses per monitor.

id.description: Optional. An id SHALL only be given to replace an existing monitor. The Charging Station handles the generation of id’s for new monitors.

transaction.description: Optional. Monitor only active when a transaction is ongoing on a component relevant to this transaction. Default = false.

value.description: Required. Value for threshold or delta monitoring. For Periodic or PeriodicClockAligned this is the interval in seconds.

type.description: Required. The type of this monitor, e.g. a threshold, delta or periodic monitor.

severity.description:
Required. The severity that will be assigned to an event
     * that is triggered by this monitor. The severity range is 0-9,
     * with 0 as the highest and 9 as the lowest severity level.
     * The severity levels have the following meaning:
     * 0-Danger
     * Indicates lives are potentially in danger. Urgent attention
     * is needed and action should be taken immediately.
     * 1-Hardware Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to Hardware issues. Action is
     * required.
     * 2-System Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to software or minor hardware
     * issues. Action is required.
     * 3-Critical
     * Indicates a critical error. Action is required.
     * 4-Error
     * Indicates a non-urgent error. Action is required.
     * 5-Alert
     * Indicates an alert event. Default severity for any type of
     * monitoring event.
     * 6-Warning
     * Indicates a warning event. Action may be required.
     * 7-Notice
     * Indicates an unusual event. No immediate action is
     * required.
     * 8-Informational
     * Indicates a regular operational event. May be used for
     * reporting, measuring throughput, etc. No action is
     * required.
     * 9-Debug
     * Indicates information useful to developers for debugging,
     * not useful during operations.

OcppSetMonitoringDataType.description: Required. List of MonitoringData containing monitoring settings.

setMonitoringData.description: Required. List of MonitoringData containing monitoring settings.

status.description: Required. Result of operation.

apn.description: Required. The Access Point Name as an URL.

preferredNetwork.description: Optional. Preferred network, written as MCC and MNC concatenated. See note.

useOnlyPreferredNetwork.description: Optional. Default: false. Use only the preferred Network, do not dial in when not available. See Note.

OcppAPNType.description: Optional. Collection of configuration data needed to make a data-connection over a cellular network.

ocppVersion.description: Required. Defines the OCPP version used for this communication function.

ocppTransport.description: Required. Defines the transport protocol (e.g. SOAP or JSON). Note: SOAP is not supported in OCPP 2.0, but is supported by other versions of OCPP.

ocppCsmsUrl.description: Required. URL of the CSMS(s) that this Charging Station communicates with.

messageTimeout.description: Required. Duration in seconds before a message send by the Charging Station via this network connection times out. The best setting depends on the underlying network and response times of the CSMS. If you are looking for a some guideline: use 30 seconds as a starting point.

securityProfile.description: Required. This field specifies the security profile used when connecting to the CSMS with this NetworkConnectionProfile.

OcppVPNType.description: Optional. Settings to be used to set up the VPN connection

configurationSlot.description: Required. Slot in which the configuration should be stored

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

severity.description:
* Required. The Charging Station SHALL only report events
     * with a severity number lower than or equal to this
     * severity. The severity range is 0-9, with 0 as the highest
     * and 9 as the lowest severity level.
     * The severity levels have the following meaning:
     * 0-Danger
     * Indicates lives are potentially in danger. Urgent attention
     * is needed and action should be taken immediately.
     * 1-Hardware Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to Hardware issues. Action is
     * required.
     * 2-System Failure
     * Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue
     * regular operations due to software or minor hardware
     * issues. Action is required.
     * 3-Critical
     * Indicates a critical error. Action is required.
     * 4-Error
     * Indicates a non-urgent error. Action is required.
     * 5-Alert
     * Indicates an alert event. Default severity for any type of
     * monitoring event.
     * 6-Warning
     * Indicates a warning event. Action may be required.
     * 7-Notice
     * Indicates an unusual event. No immediate action is
     * required.
     * 8-Informational
     * Indicates a regular operational event. May be used for
     * reporting, measuring throughput, etc. No action is
     * required.
     * 9-Debug
     * Indicates information useful to developers for debugging,
     * not useful during operations.

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

monitoringBase.description: Required. Specify which monitoring base will be set

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station is able to display the message.

language.description: Optional. Message language identifier. Contains a language code as defined in [RFC5646].

OcppMessageContentType.description: Required. Contains message details for the message to be displayed on a Charging Station.

id.description: Required. Unique id within an exchange context. It is defined within the OCPP context as a positive Integer value (greater or equal to zero).

priority.description: Required. With what priority should this message be shown

state.description: Optional. During what state should this message be shown. When omitted this message should be shown in any state of the Charging Station.

startDateTime.description: Optional. From what date-time should this message be shown. If omitted: directly.

endDateTime.description: Optional. Until what date-time should this message be shown, after this date/time this message SHALL be removed.

transactionId.description: Optional. During which transaction shall this message be shown. Message SHALL be removed by the Charging Station after transaction has ended.

OcppMessageInfoType.description: Required. Message to be configured in the Charging Station, to be displayed.

status.description: Required. Returns whether the Charging Station has been able to process the message successfully. This does not guarantee the schedule will be followed to the letter. There might be other constraints the Charging Station may need to take into account.

stackLevel.description: Required. Value determining level in hierarchy stack of profiles. Higher values have precedence over lower values. Lowest level is 0.

chargingProfilePurpose.description: Required. Defines the purpose of the schedule transferred by this profile

chargingProfileKind.description: Required. Indicates the kind of schedule.

recurrencyKind.description: Optional. Indicates the start point of a recurrence

validFrom.description: Optional. Point in time at which the profile starts to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid as soon as it is received by the Charging Station

validTo.description: Optional. Point in time at which the profile stops to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid until it is replaced by another profile.

transactionId.description: Optional. SHALL only be included when ChargingProfilePurpose is set to TxProfile in a SetChargingProfileRequest. The transactionId is used to match the profile to a specific transaction.

OcppChargingProfileType.description: Required. The charging profile to be set at the Charging Station.

startPeriod.description: Required. Start of the period, in seconds from the start of schedule. The value of StartPeriod also defines the stop time of the previous period.

limit.description: Required. Charging rate limit during the schedule period, in the applicable chargingRateUnit, for example in Amperes (A) or Watts (W). Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1).

numberPhases.description: Optional. The number of phases that can be used for charging. If a number of phases is needed, numberPhases=3 will be assumed unless another number is given.

phaseToUse.description: Optional. Values: 1..3, Used if numberPhases=1 and if the EVSE is capable of switching the phase connected to the EV, i.e. ACPhaseSwitchingSupported is defined and true. It’s not allowed unless both conditions above are true. If both conditions are true, and phaseToUse is omitted, the Charging Station / EVSE will make the selection on its own.

OcppChargingSchedulePeriodType.description: Required. List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time.

startSchedule.description: Optional. Starting point of an absolute schedule. If absent the schedule will be relative to start of charging.

duration.description: Optional. Duration of the charging schedule in seconds. If the duration is left empty, the last period will continue indefinitely or until end of the transaction if chargingProfilePurpose = TxProfile.

chargingRateUnit.description: Required. The unit of measure Limit is expressed in.

minChargingRate.description: Optional. Minimum charging rate supported by the EV. The unit of measure is defined by the chargingRateUnit. This parameter is intended to be used by a local smart charging algorithm to optimize the power allocation for in the case a charging process is inefficient at lower charging rates. Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1)

chargingSchedulePeriod.description: Required. List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time. The maximum number of periods, that is supported by the Charging Station, if less than 1024, is set by device model variable SmartChargingCtrlr.PeriodsPerSchedule.

OcppChargingScheduleType.description: Required. Schedule that contains limits for the available power or current over time. In order to support ISO 15118 schedule negotiation, it supports at most three schedules with associated tariff to choose from.

startValue.description: Required. The lowest level of consumption that defines the starting point of this consumption block. The block interval extends to the start of the next interval.

cost.description: Required. This field contains the cost details.

OcppConsumptionCostType.description: Optional. Defines additional means for further relative price information and/or alternative costs.

costKind.description: Required. The kind of cost referred to in the message element amount

amount.description: Required. The estimated or actual cost per kWh

amountMultiplier.description: Optional. Values: -3..3, The amountMultiplier defines the exponent to base 10 (dec). The final value is determined by: amount * 10 ^ amountMultiplier

OcppCostType.description: Required. This field contains the cost details.

start.description: Required. Start of the interval, in seconds from NOW.

duration.description: Optional. Duration of the interval, in seconds

OcppRelativeTimeIntervalType.description: Required. Defines the time interval the SalesTariffEntry is valid for, based upon relative times.

consumptionCost.description: Optional. Defines additional means for further relative price information and/or alternative costs.

OcppSalesTariffEntryType.description: Required. Encapsulating element describing all relevant details for one time interval of the SalesTariff. The number of SalesTariffEntry elements is limited by the number of SalesTariffEntry elements is limited by the parameter maxScheduleTuples.

id.description: Required. SalesTariff identifier used to identify one sales tariff. An SAID remains a unique identifier for one schedule throughout a charging session

salesTariffDescription.description: Optional. A human-readable title/short description of the sales tariff e.g. for HMI display purposes

numEPriceLevels.description: Optional. Defines the overall number of distinct price levels used across all provided SalesTariff elements

salesTariffEntry.description: Required. Encapsulating element describing all relevant details for one time interval of the SalesTariff. The number of SalesTariffEntry elements is limited by the number of SalesTariffEntry elements is limited by the parameter maxScheduleTuples.

OcppSalesTariffType.description: Optional. Sales tariff associated with this charging schedule

evseId.description: Required. For TxDefaultProfile an evseId=0 applies the profile to each individual evse. For ChargingStationMaxProfile and ChargingStationExternalConstraints an evseId=0 contains an overal limit for the whole Charging Station.

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station has successfully received and applied the update of the Local Authorization List.

additionalIdToken.description: Required. This field specifies the additional IdToken.

type.description: Required. This defines the type of the additionalIdToken. This is a custom type, so the implementation needs to be agreed upon by all involved parties.

OcppAdditionalInfoType.description: Optional. AdditionalInfo can be used to send extra information which can be validated by the CSMS in addition to the regular authorization with IdToken. need to be agreed upon by all parties involved. When AdditionalInfo is NOT implemented or a not supported AdditionalInfo.type is used, the CSMS/Charging Station MAY ignore the AdditionalInfo.

OcppAuthorizationData.description: Optional. This contains the Local Authorization List entries.

status.description: Required. Current status of the ID Token

cacheExpiryDateTime.description: Optional. Date and Time after which the token must be considered invalid.

chargingPriority.description: Optional. Priority from a business point of view. Default priority is 0, The range is from -9 to 9. Higher values indicate a higher priority. The chargingPriority in TransactionEventResponse overrules this one.

language1.description: Optional. Preferred user interface language of identifier user. Contains a language code as defined in [RFC5646].

evseId.description: Optional. Only used when the IdToken is only valid for one or more specific EVSEs, not for the entire Charging Station.

items.description: Optional. Only used when the IdToken is only valid for one or more specific EVSEs, not for the entire Charging Station.

language2.description: Optional. Second preferred user interface language of identifier user. Don’t use when language1 is omitted, has to be different from language1. Contains a language code as defined in [RFC5646].

OcppIdTokenInfoType.description: Optional. Required when UpdateType is Full. This contains information about authorization status, expiry and group id. For a Differential update the following applies: If this element is present, then this entry SHALL be added or updated in the Local Authorization List. If be added or updated in the Local Authorization List. If this element is absent, the entry for this IdToken in the Local Authorization List SHALL be deleted.

idToken.description: Required. IdToken is case-insensitive. Might hold the hidden id of an RFID tag, but can for example also contain a UUID.

type.description: Required. Enumeration of possible idToken types

additionalInfoType.description: Optional. AdditionalInfo can be used to send extra information which can be validated by the CSMS in addition to the regular authorization with IdToken. need to be agreed upon by all parties involved. When AdditionalInfo is NOT implemented or a not supported AdditionalInfo.type is used, the CSMS/Charging Station MAY ignore the AdditionalInfo.

OcppIdTokenType.description: Required. This contains the identifier which needs to be stored for authorization.

versionNumber.description: Required. In case of a full update this is the version number of the full list. In case of a differential update it is the version number of the list after the update has been applied.

updateType.description: Required. This contains the type of update (full or differential) of this request.

localAuthorizationList.description: Optional. This contains the Local Authorization List entries.

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station is able to perform the reset.

type.description: The type of reset that the Charging Station or EVSE should perform.

evseId.description: The ID of a specific EVSE that needs to be reset, instead of the entire Charging Station.

status.description: Required. This indicates the success or failure of the reservation.

expiryDateTime.description: Required. Date and time at which the reservation expires.

connectorType.description: Optional. This field specifies the connector type.

evseId.description: Optional. This contains ID of the evse to be reserved.

status.description: Required. Status indicating whether Charging Station accepts the request to stop a transaction.

transactionId.description: Required. The identifier of the transaction which the Charging Station is requested to stop.

status.description: Required. Status indicating whether the Charging Station accepts the request to start a transaction.

transactionId.description: Optional. When the transaction was already started by the Charging Station before the RequestStartTransactionRequest was received, for example: cable plugged in first. This contains the transactionId of the already started transaction.

evseId.description: Optional. Number of the EVSE on which to start the transaction. EvseId SHALL be > 0

remoteStartId.description: Required. Id given by the server to this start request. The Charging Station will return this in the TransactionEventRequest, letting the server know which transaction was started for this request.

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the request was accepted.

location.description: Required. This contains a string containing a URI pointing to a location from which to retrieve the firmware.

retries.description: Optional. This specifies how many times Charging Station must try to download the firmware before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how many times it wants to retry.

checksum.description: Required. The MD5 checksum over the entire firmware file as a hexadecimal string of length 32

requestId.description: Required. The Id of the request

retryInterval.description: Optional. The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how long to wait between attempts.

certificateType.description: Required. Indicates the certificate type that is sent.

certificate.description: Required. A PEM encoded X.509 certificate.

getVariableResult.description: Required. List of requested variables and their values.

attributeStatus.description: Required. Result status of getting the variable.

attributeType.description: Optional. Attribute type for which value is requested. When absent, default Actual is assumed.

attributeValue.description: Optional. Value of requested attribute type of component variable. This field can only be empty when the given status is NOT accepted. The Configuration Variable ReportingValueSize can be used to limit GetVariableResult.attributeValue, VariableAttribute.value and EventData.actualValue. The max size of these values will always remain equal.

OcppGetVariableResultType.description: Required. List of requested variables and their values.

attributeType.description: Optional. Attribute type for which value is requested. When absent, default Actual is assumed.

ongoingIndicator.description: Optional. Whether the transaction is still ongoing

messagesInQueue.description: Required. Whether there are still message to be delivered.

transactionId.description: Optional. The Id of the transaction for which the status is requested.

status.description: Required. This field indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

requestId.description: Required. The Id of the request

monitoringCriteria.description: Optional. This field contains criteria for components for which a monitoring report is requested

items.description: Optional. This field contains criteria for components for which a monitoring report is requested

componentVariable.description: Optional. This field specifies the components and variables for which a monitoring report is requested.

status.description: Required. This field indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

filename.description: Optional. This contains the name of the log file that will be uploaded. This field is not present when no logging information is available.

logType.description: Required. This contains the type of log file that the Charging Station should send.

requestId.description: Required. The Id of this request

retries.description: Optional. This specifies how many times the Charging Station must try to upload the log before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retryInterval.description: Optional. The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charging Station to decide how long to wait between attempts.

remoteLocation.description: Required. The URL of the location at the remote system where the log should be stored.

oldestTimestamp.description: Optional. This contains the date and time of the oldest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

latestTimestamp.description: Optional. This contains the date and time of the latest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

OcppLogParametersType.description: Required. This field specifies the requested log and the location to which the log should be sent.

versionNumber.description: Required. This contains the current version number of the local authorization list in the Charging Station.

status.description: Required. Charging Station indicates if it can process the request.

certificateHashDataChain.description: Optional. The Charging Station includes the Certificate information for each available certificate.

certificateType.description: Required. Indicates the type of the requested certificate(s).

OcppCertificateHashDataChainType.description: Optional. The Charging Station includes the Certificate information for each available certificate.

hashAlgorithm.description: Required. Used algorithms for the hashes provided.

issuerNameHash.description: Required. Hashed value of the Issuer DN (Distinguished Name).

issuerKeyHash.description: Required. Hashed value of the issuers public key

serialNumber.description: Required. The serial number of the certificate.

OcppCertificateHashDataType.description: Optional. Information to identify the child certificate(s).

certificateType.description: Optional. Indicates the type of certificates requested. When omitted, all certificate types are requested.

items.description: Optional. Indicates the type of certificates requested. When omitted, all certificate types are requested.

status.description: Required. Indicates if the Charging Station has Display Messages that match the request criteria in the GetDisplayMessagesRequest

id.description: Optional. If provided the Charging Station shall return Display Messages of the given ids. This field SHALL NOT contain more ids than set in NumberOfDisplayMessages.maxLimit

items.description: Optional. If provided the Charging Station shall return Display Messages of the given ids. This field SHALL NOT contain more ids than set in NumberOfDisplayMessages.maxLimit

requestId.description: Required. The Id of this request.

priority.description: Optional. If provided the Charging Station shall return Display Messages with the given priority only.

state.description: Optional. If provided the Charging Station shall return Display Messages with the given state only.

status.description: Required. This field indicates whether the Charging Station was able to accept the request.

requestId.description: Required. The Id of the request.

componentCriteria.description: Optional. This field contains criteria for components for which a report is requested

items.description: Optional. This field contains criteria for components for which a report is requested

componentVariable.description: Optional. This field specifies the components and variables for which a report is requested.

OcppComponentVariableType.description: Optional. This field specifies the components and variables for which a report is requested.

status.description: Required. The Charging Station will indicate if it was able to process the request

evseId.description: Required. The ID of the EVSE for which the schedule is requested. When evseid=0, the Charging Station calculated the expected consumption for the grid connection.

duration.description: Required. Duration of the schedule in seconds.

scheduleStart.description: Required. Date and time at which the schedule becomes active. All time measurements within the schedule are relative to this timestamp.

chargingRateUnit.description: Required. The unit of measure Limit is expressed in.

chargingSchedulePeriod.description: Required. List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time.

OcppCompositeScheduleType.description: Optional. This field contains the calculated composite schedule. It may only be omitted when this message contains status Rejected

duration.description: Required. Length of the requested schedule in seconds.

chargingRateUnit.description: Optional. Can be used to force a power or current profile.

evseId.description: Required. The ID of the EVSE for which the schedule is requested. When evseid=0, the Charging Station will calculate the expected consumption for the grid connection.

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station is able to process this request and will send ReportChargingProfilesRequest messages.

requestId.description: Required. Reference identification that is to be used by the Charging Station in the ReportChargingProfilesRequest when provided.

evseId.description: Optional. For which EVSE installed charging profiles SHALL be reported. If 0, only charging profiles installed on the Charging Station itself (the grid connection) SHALL be reported. If omitted, all installed charging profiles SHALL be reported. Reported charging profiles SHALL match the criteria in field chargingProfile.

chargingProfilePurpose.description: Optional. Defines the purpose of the schedule transferred by this profile

stackLevel.description: Optional. Value determining level in hierarchy stack of profiles. Higher values have precedence over lower values. Lowest level is 0.

chargingProfileId.description: Optional. List of all the chargingProfileIds requested. Any ChargingProfile that matches one of these profiles will be reported. If omitted, the Charging Station SHALL not filter on chargingProfileId. This field SHALL NOT contain more ids than set in ChargingProfileEntries.maxLimit

items.description: Optional. List of all the chargingProfileIds requested. Any ChargingProfile that matches one of these profiles will be reported. If omitted, the Charging Station SHALL not filter on chargingProfileId. This field SHALL NOT contain more ids than set in ChargingProfileEntries.maxLimit

chargingLimitSource.description: Optional. For which charging limit sources, charging profiles SHALL be reported. If omitted, the Charging Station SHALL not filter on chargingLimitSource.

items.description: Optional. For which charging limit sources, charging profiles SHALL be reported. If omitted, the Charging Station SHALL not filter on chargingLimitSource.

status.description: Required. This indicates whether the Charging Station is able to accept this request

requestId.description: Required. The Id of the request.

reportBase.description: Required. This field specifies the report base.

status.description: Required. Charging Station indicates if it can process the request
Required. This indicates the success or failure of the data transfer.

data.description: Optional. Data without specified length or format, in response to request.

messageId.description: Optional. May be used to indicate a specific message or implementation.

data.description: Optional. Data without specified length or format. This needs to be decided by both parties (Open to implementation).

vendorId.description: Required. This identifies the Vendor specific implementation

status.description: Required. Indicates whether the request was accepted.

requestId.description: Required. The Id of the request.

report.description: Required. Flag indicating whether the Charging Station should return NotifyCustomerInformationRequest messages containing information about the customer referred to.

clear.description: Required. Flag indicating whether the Charging Station should clear all information about the customer referred to

customerIdentifier.description: Optional. A (e.g. vendor specific) identifier of the customer this request refers to. This field contains a custom identifier other than IdToken and Certificate. One of the possible identifiers (customerIdentifier, customerIdToken or customerCertificate) should be in the request message

totalCost.description: Required. Current total cost, based on the information known by the CSMS, of the transaction including taxes. In the currency configured with the configuration Variable: [Currency]

transactionId.description: Required. Transaction Id of the transaction the current cost are asked for.

clearMonitoringResult.description: Required. List of result statuses per monitor.

status.description: Required. Result of the clear request for this monitor, identified by its Id.

id.description: Required. Id of the monitor of which a clear was requested.

OcppClearMonitoringResultType.description: Required. List of result statuses per monitor.

id.description: Required. List of the monitors to be cleared, identified by there Id.

items.description: Required. List of the monitors to be cleared, identified by there Id.

status.description: Required. Returns whether the Charging Station has been able to remove the message.

id.description: Required. Id of the message that SHALL be removed from the Charging Station.

status.description: Required. Indicates if the Charging Station was able to execute the request.

chargingProfileId.description: Optional. The Id of the charging profile to clear.

evseId.description: Optional. Specifies the id of the EVSE for which to clear charging profiles. An evseId of zero (0) specifies the charging profile for the overall Charging Station. Absence of this parameter means the clearing applies to all charging profiles that match the other criteria in the request.

chargingProfilePurpose.description: Optional. Specifies to purpose of the charging profiles that will be cleared, if they meet the other criteria in the request.

stackLevel.description: Optional. Specifies the stackLevel for which charging profiles will be cleared, if they meet the other criteria in the request.

status.description: Accepted if the Charging Station has executed the request, otherwise rejected.

operationalStatus.description: Required. This contains the type of availability change that the Charging Station should perform.

status.description: Required. Returns whether certificate signing has been accepted, otherwise rejected.

certificateChain.description: Required. The signed PEM encoded X.509 certificate. This can also contain the necessary sub CA certificates. In that case, the order of the bundle should follow the certificate chain, starting from the leaf certificate. The Configuration Variable MaxCertificateChainSize can be used to limit the maximum size of this field.

status.description: Required. This indicates the success or failure of the canceling of a reservation by CSMS.

reservationId.description: Required. Id of the reservation to cancel.

certificateType.description: Optional. Indicates the type of the signed certificate that is returned. When omitted the certificate is used for both the 15118 connection (if implemented) and the Charging Station to CSMS connection. This field is required when a typeOfCertificate was included in the SignCertificateRequest that requested this certificate to be signed AND both the 15118 connection and the Charging Station connection are implemented.

location.description: This contains a string containing a URI pointing to a location from which to retrieve the firmware.

retries.description: This specifies how many times Charge Point must try to download the firmware before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retrieveDate.description: This contains the date and time after which the Charge Point is allowed to retrieve the (new) firmware.

retryInterval.description: The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how long to wait between attempts.

status.description: This indicates whether the Charge Point has unlocked the connector.

connectorId.description: This contains the identifier of the connector to be unlocked.

status.description: Indicates whether the Charge Point will send the requested notification or not.

connectorId.description: Only filled in when request applies to a specific connector.

status.description: Returns whether the Charge Point has been able to process the message successfully. This does not guarantee the schedule will be followed to the letter. There might be other constraints the Charge Point may need to take into account.

transactionId.description: Only valid if ChargingProfilePurpose is set to TxProfile, the transactionId MAY be used to match the profile to a specific transaction.

stackLevel.description: Value determining level in hierarchy stack of profiles. Higher values have precedence over lower values. Lowest level is 0.

recurrencyKind.description: Indicates the start point of a recurrence. SHALL only be used when the field: recurrencyKind is set to: Recurring.

validFrom.description: Point in time at which the profile starts to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid as soon as it is received by the Charge Point.

validTo.description: Point in time at which the profile stops to be valid. If absent, the profile is valid until it is replaced by another profile.

OcppChargingProfile.description: The charging profile to be set at the Charge Point.

duration.description: Duration of the charging schedule in seconds. If the duration is left empty, the last period will continue indefinitely or until end of the transaction in case startSchedule is absent.

startSchedule.description: Starting point of an absolute schedule. If absent the schedule will be relative to start of charging. When ChargingSchedule is used as part of a GetCompositeSchedule.conf message, then this field must be omitted.

chargingRateUnit.description: The unit of measure Limit is expressed in.

chargingSchedulePeriod.description: List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time. The startPeriod of the first ChargingSchedulePeriod SHALL always be 0.

minChargingRate.description: Minimum charging rate supported by the electric vehicle. The unit of measure is defined by the chargingRateUnit. This parameter is intended to be used by a local smart charging algorithm to optimize the power allocation for in the case a charging process is inefficient at lower charging rates. Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1)

OcppChargingSchedule.description: Planned Composite Charging Schedule, the energy consumption over time. Always relative to ScheduleStart. If status is "Rejected", this field may be absent.

startPeriod.description: Start of the period, in seconds from the start of schedule. The value of StartPeriod also defines the stop time of the previous period.

limit.description: Charging rate limit during the schedule period, in the applicable chargingRateUnit, for example in Amperes or Watts. Accepts at most one digit fraction (e.g. 8.1).

numberPhases.description: The number of phases that can be used for charging. If a number of phases is needed, numberPhases=3 will be assumed unless another number is given.

OcppChargingSchedulePeriod.description: List of ChargingSchedulePeriod elements defining maximum power or current usage over time. The startPeriod of the first ChargingSchedulePeriod SHALL always be 0.

connectorId.description: The connector to which the charging profile applies. If connectorId = 0, and the message contains a ChargePointMaxProfile it contains an overall limit for the Charge Point. If connectorId = 0, and the message contains a TxDefaultProfile it contains limits that are to be used for any new transaction on any connector of that Charge Point.

status.description: This indicates whether the Charge Point is able to perform the reset.

type.description: This contains the type of reset that the Charge Point should perform.

status.description: Status indicating whether Charge Point accepts the request to stop a transaction.

transactionId.description: This contains the identifier of the transaction which Charge Point is requested to stop.

status.description: Status indicating whether Charge Point accepts the request to start a transaction.

connectorId.description: Number of the connector on which to start the transaction. connectorId SHALL be > 0.

idTag.description: The identifier that Charge Point must use to start a transaction. Case-insensitive, max length 20. idTag of vehicle owner

fileName.description: This contains the name of the file with diagnostic information that will be uploaded. This field is not present when no diagnostic information is available. Case-insensitive, max length 255.

location.description: This contains the location (directory) where the diagnostics file shall be uploaded to.

retries.description: This specifies how many times Charge Point must retry to upload the diagnostics before giving up. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how many times it wants to retry.

retryInterval.description: The interval in seconds after which a retry may be attempted. If this field is not present, it is left to Charge Point to decide how long to wait between attempts.

startTime.description: This contains the date and time of the oldest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

stopTime.description: This contains the date and time of the latest logging information to include in the diagnostics.

status.description: Status of the request. The Charge Point will indicate if it was able to process the request.

connectorId.description: The charging schedule contained in this notification applies to a Connector.

scheduleStart.description: Time. Periods contained in the charging profile are relative to this point in time. If status is "Rejected", this field may be absent.

connectorId.description: The ID of the Connector for which the schedule is requested. When ConnectorId=0, the Charge Point will calculate the expected consumption for the grid connection.

duration.description: Time in seconds. length of requested schedule.

chargingRateUnit.description: Can be used to force a power or current profile.

status.description: This indicates the success or failure of the data transfer.

vendorId.description: This identifies the Vendor specific implementation. Case-insensitive, max length 255.

messageId.description: Additional identification field. Case-insensitive, max length 50.

data.description: Data without specified length or format.

status.description: Returns whether configuration change has been accepted.

key.description: The name of the configuration setting to change. See for standard configuration key names and associated values. Case-insensitive, max length 50.

value.description: The new value as string for the setting. See for standard configuration key names and associated values. Case-insensitive, max length 500.

status.description: Indicates if the Charge Point was able to execute the request.

id.description: The ID of the charging profile to clear.

connectorId.description: Specifies the ID of the connector for which to clear charging profiles. A connectorId of zero (0) specifies the charging profile for the overall Charge Point. Absence of this parameter means the clearing applies to all charging profiles that match the other criteria in the request.

chargingProfilePurpose.description: Specifies to purpose of the charging profiles that will be cleared, if they meet the other criteria in the request.

stackLevel.description: Specifies the stackLevel for which charging profiles will be cleared, if they meet the other criteria in the request.

status.description: Accepted if the Charge Point has executed the request, otherwise rejected.
This indicates whether the Charge Point is able to perform the availability change.

connectorId.description: The id of the connector for which availability needs to change. Id '0' (zero) is used if the availability of the Charge Point and all its connectors needs to change.

type.description: This contains the type of availability change that the Charge Point should perform.

content.description: HTML code of the imprint page.

Imprint.description: Object that contains the Imprint page in HTML format.

ImprintRequest.description: Request to Create or Update Imprint component.

isDefault.description: Identifies if the current CSMS is the default one or not

username.description: The user name of the CSMS credentials

password.description: The password of the CSMS credentials

confirmPassword.description: The confirmation password of the CSMS credentials

ocppProtocol.description: Defines the OCPP protocol version which is supported by the CSMS in case only one version is supported. Will be used for protocol version translation

isCsmsCredentialsUsed.description: Identifies whether the CSMS credentials are going to be used or not.

createdAt.description: Date the key was created at.

usernameToBeRemoved.description: Indicates whether the username should be set to null or not

passwordToBeRemoved.description: Indicates whether the password should be set to null or not

isActive.description: Indicates if the user account is active

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user

displayName.description: The display name of the user

identityKey.description: The identity key of the charging station

evseId.description: The Evse ID of the connector

reservationId.description: The id of the reservation that terminates as a result of this transaction.

idTagStart.description: The identifier for which a transaction has to be started

idTagStop.description: The identifier which requested to stop the charging. It is optional because a Charge Point may terminate charging without the presence of an idTag, e.g. in case of a reset.

reason.description: The reason for stopping a transaction

transactionData.description: Transaction usage details relevant for billing purposes

meterValues.description: Optional meter values sampled during the transaction

meterStart.description: The meter value in Wh for the connector at start of the transaction

meterLatest.description: The latest meter value in Wh for the connector

meterStop.description: The meter value in Wh for the connector at end of the transaction

powerLatest.description: The latest power in Watt measured for the connector

timestampStart.description: The date and time on which the transaction is started

timestampStop.description: The date and time on which the transaction is stopped

timestampLastUpdate.description: The date and time on which the transaction was updated

BrokerTransaction.description: The list of transactions of the last 24 hours

expiryDate.description: This contains the date at which idTag should be removed from the Authorization Cache.

parentIdTag.description: This contains the parent-identifier. Case-insensitive, max length 20.

status.description: This contains whether the idTag has been accepted or not by the Central System.

OcppIdTagInfo.description: Information about authorization status expiry and parent id.

OcppMeterValue.description: Optional meter values sampled during the transaction

value.description: Value as a “Raw” (decimal) number or “SignedData”. Field Type is “string” to allow for digitally signed data readings. Decimal numeric values are also acceptable to allow fractional values for measurands such as Temperature and Current.

context.description: Type of detail value: start, end or sample.

phase.description: Indicates how the measured value is to be interpreted. For instance between L1 and neutral (L1-N) Please note that not all values of phase are applicable to all Measurands. When phase is absent, the measured value is interpreted as an overall value.

identityKey.description: The Identity Key of the Charging Station

type.description: The type of the security event

techInfo.description: Additional information about the occurred security event

timestamp.description: The date and time at which the security event occurred

messageUuid.description: The UUID of the OCPP message

timestamp.description: The date and time of the OCPP message

procedureName.description: The name of the OCPP procedure or action

callId.description: The unique identifier for matching request and result

payload.description: The JSON payload of the message

rawMessage.description: The raw message which was transported over the WebSocket

uri.description: Return the URI used to open the WebSocket connection.

additionalProperties.description: Return the headers used in the handshake request (never {@code null}).

items.description: Return the headers used in the handshake request (never {@code null}).

httpHandshakeHeaders.description: Return the headers used in the handshake request (never {@code null}).

additionalProperties.description:
Return the map with attributes associated with the WebSocket session.
On the server side the map can be populated initially through a {@link org.springframework.web.socket.server.HandshakeInterceptor HandshakeInterceptor}.
On the client side the map can be populated via {@link org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketClient WebSocketClient} handshake methods.

attributes.description:
Return the map with attributes associated with the WebSocket session.
On the server side the map can be populated initially through a {@link org.springframework.web.socket.server.HandshakeInterceptor HandshakeInterceptor}.
On the client side the map can be populated via {@link org.springframework.web.socket.client.WebSocketClient WebSocketClient} handshake methods.

BrokerWebSocketSession.description: Details of the WebSocket session with broker.

WebSocketCloseStatus.description: Details about the closing process of the WebSocket session.

serviceInstance.description: Specifies the service instance of the log.

webSocketInteraction.description: Represents the connection between the Broker.

errorReason.description: Details about the error reason, if it occurred.

timestamp.description: The date and time of the network log entry.

WebSocketNetworkLogResponse.description: Class representing detailed information about a WebSocket network log entry.

configurationKey.description: List of requested or known keys.

unknownKey.description: Requested keys that are unknown. Keys are case-insensitive, with max length = 50.

items.description: Requested keys that are unknown. Keys are case-insensitive, with max length = 50.

readonly.description: False if the value can be set with the ChangeConfiguration message.

value.description: If key is known but not set, this field may be absent. Case-insensitive, max length 500.

OcppKeyValue.description: List of requested or known keys.

transactionsLast24.description: The number of transactions for the last 24 hours

energyTotal.description: The total energy of all transactions in Wh

energyTotalLast24.description: The total energy of all transactions for the last 24 hours in Wh

issuesLast24.description: The number of OCPP issues during the last 24 hours

successRateLast24.description: The charging transaction success rate during the last 24 hours

transactionListLast24.description: The list of transactions of the last 24 hours

transactionTimeSlices.description: The transaction time slices of the last 24 hours

dateSlice.description: The date and time of the time slice

activeTransactions.description: The number of active transactions during the time slice

maxTotalPower.description: The maximum total power during the time slice in kW

connectorErrorRate.description: The error rate of the time slice

latestCompletedTransactions.description: Transactions that were completed before this and after last timeslice

completedTransactionsLast30Days.description: Number of completed transactions in the last 30 days

averageConnectorUptime.description: Average uptime of all connectors in the last 24h

totalConsumption.description: The total consumption during the time slice in kWh

chargingStationsTotal.description: The number of total charging stations

chargingStationsOnline.description: The number of online charging stations

chargingStationsCsmsConnected.description: The number of CSMS connected charging stations

modelName.description: This contains a value that identifies the model of the Charging Station

count.description: The amount of charging stations of the specific model
The number of charging stations which negotiated the protocol version
The number of elements having the specific OCPP status

variableAttribute.description: The attribute data of the variable

dateLastUpdate.description: The date and time of the configuration key shadow

type.description: Optional. Attribute: Actual, MinSet, MaxSet, etc. Defaults to Actual if absent.

value.description: Optional. Value of the attribute. May only be omitted when mutability is set to 'WriteOnly'. The Configuration Variable ReportingValueSize can be used to limit GetVariableResult.attributeValue, VariableAttribute.value and EventData.actualValue. The max size of these values will always remain equal.

mutability.description: Optional. Defines the mutability of this attribute. Default is ReadWrite when omitted.

persistent.description: Optional. If true, value will be persistent across system reboots or power down. Default when omitted is false

constant.description: Optional. If true, value that will never be changed by the Charging Station at runtime. Default when omitted is false.

OcppVariableAttributeType.description: The attribute data of the variable

unit.description: Optional. Unit of the variable. When the transmitted value has a unit, this field SHALL be included.

dataType.description: Required. Data type of this variable.

minLimit.description: Optional. Minimum possible value of this variable.

maxLimit.description: Optional. Maximum possible value of this variable. When the datatype of this Variable is String, OptionList, SequenceList or MemberList, this field defines the maximum length of the (CSV) string.

valuesList.description:
Optional. Allowed values when variable is
     Option/Member/SequenceList.
     * OptionList: The (Actual) Variable value must be a single
     value from the reported (CSV) enumeration list.
     * MemberList: The (Actual) Variable value may be an
     (unordered) (sub-)set of the reported (CSV) valid values
     list.
     * SequenceList: The (Actual) Variable value may be an
     ordered (priority, etc) (sub-)set of the reported (CSV) valid
     values.
     This is a comma separated list.
     The Configuration Variable ConfigurationValueSize can
     be used to limit SetVariableData.attributeValue and
     VariableCharacteristics.valueList. The max size of these
     values will always remain equal.

supportsMonitoring.description: Required. Flag indicating if this variable supports monitoring.

readonly.description: Indicates if the configuration key is readonly

dateLastUpdate.description: The date and time of the configuration key shadow

id.description: The ID of the charging station alert

dateCreated.description: The date and time of the date created alert

dateResolved.description: The date and time of the date resolved alert

vendorErrorCode.description: This contains the vendor-specific error code.

errorInfo.description: Additional free format information related to the error.

evseId.description: The Evse ID of the connector

standard.description: The standard of the installed connector.
